revised_title: Climatic Variability and Glaciation Correlation in the North Atlantic Region
tldr: The article investigates the correlation of marine events and glaciations in the northeast Atlantic region over the past three million years. Using aminostratigraphy and other dating methods, the authors recognize eight high-sea-level events and their corresponding glaciations. This research helps to model ice accumulation, precipitation patterns, and the circulation of the North Atlantic Ocean, contributing to a better understanding of climatic change in the British Isles and Europe.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Stratigraphy and Paleoclimatology
